title: Hextech Crystals are Skarner 's people
body: I was wondering if anyone else noticed that the new  Piltover lore pays a lot of attention to these  power crystals.  What if this links into the introduction of skarner 's people as the source of these crystals?

replies.body:

Honestly I kinda fear that Skarner charges into Piltover and gets subdued and maybe even killed by the piltovians.

Yeah, I actually thought about that and I do feel like he'd likely at least get captured; I can see him confronting Jayce, only to realize that the Piltie had managed to hear the Dreamsong before, the two stopping at the realization and having an _odd magical connection moment_, mere seconds before the ol' Bracken's off-guard entrapment.

Whatever may happen afterwards, I think that it would be far from Skarner's end- What if Jayce will actually start questioning the Crystals Hextech as a power source? What if realizes that _the tomorrow_ he's known for defending was actually the wrong one? What if he actually frees Skarner?

It is already known.  [Camille's bio](http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_US/story/champion/camille/) mentions that her family got rich off of the crystal scorpion's namestones (hextech crystals). 

"Camille's family gained most of its wealth through a rare crystal harvested from a creature native to the sands of a distant valley."

Wait, I haven't really been paying attention to the new lore. Are these crystals Skarner's *people* or are they his people**'s**? Because the first option would be really dark, especially for Piltover.

The crystals are called lifestones/namestones and give the Brackern tons of magical power, extend their already long lives and allow their conciousness to live on in the stones after death. Brackern claim a crystal for themselves which is needed for them to grow and develop. It also lets them communicate in a sort of telepathic way, which can be best attributed to singing as far as the Brackern's description of it goes.

Some times ago Camille's long dead relative discovered the slumbering Brackern in Shurima and set about claiming their lifestones, which became the first hex-crystals, used as power sources for various hextech devices. 

You can read more here:

http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/champion/skarner/
http://universe.leagueoflegends.com/en_GB/story/champion/camille/
